WorkItem.ClosedComment: We've added some new options to only reload in smaller batches (relevant per slot)
WorkItem.Description:
I find that, after downloading a new version of Rawr, the item cache is often screwed up. I need to restrict it to Heroic- and Emblem-only gear, and so much of what ends up on my lists is wrong that I have to go item-by-item for like half an hour to weed out stuff that isn't supposed to be there. It would be nice to either be able to reload a group of items simultaneously from the Armory (or WoWhead) or to be able to have it only update its cache for items that are upgrades in the current model I am browsing. Or any other way to make fixing my item cache upon every new release easier. :)
Â 
Thanks!
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.Items] Easier reloading of items from Armory/Wowhead

Comments.Message: No, that's not what I want to do. I don't want to reload the entire cache of all 4000 or whatever items. Especially because WoWHead seems to get Emblem items right (Armory seems to always think they're sold in Crystalsong Forest) and WoWHead gets new dungeons screwed up.

Please read the Posting Guidelines and Documentation.

1) Tools > Update Item Cache from Armory/Wowhead...



** Closed by Jothay 12/28/2009 11:25 AM
I wasn't very clear, I suppose, about what I was referring to...
Crystalsong Forest is the Major zone for Dalaran, meaning, those items are sold in Dalaran (though the Armory likes to call it by it's major zone)

Yes, I know *why* it's saying the Crystalsong Forest, but when it says "sold by XX in Crystalsong Forest" it never knows what the price is (e.g., Emblems of Frost) and therefore doesn't categorize the items properly.
